Detailed Description

Widget that acts as a dividing bar or resizing handle.

This widget is a simple bar oriented in a vertical or horizontal direction. It displays an appropriate splitter-cursor when the mouse is over it, and draws an opaque shadow when it is "dragged". It requires you to handle all resize and toggle click events. DzDynamicDividerWgt is a convenience class that handles resize events and toggling of the divider bar for you.

See also:
DzDynamicDividerWgt

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum DzDividerBar::BarStyle

Specifies the type/thickness of the divider bar

Enumerator:
BSFull 

Use the thick divider bar

BSSemi 

Use the medium sized divider bar

BSThin 

Use the thin divider bar

enum DzDividerBar::WidgetType

Enumeration for referencing widgets relative to the divider bar

Enumerator:
WTLeftOrTop 

References the widget to the left of the divider if the orientation is vertical or the widget to the top of the divider if the orientation is horizontal

WTRightOrBottom 

References the widget to the right of the divider if the orientation is vertical or the widget to the bottom of the divider if the orientation is horizontal

WTBoth 

References both widgets of the divider bar

WTNone 

References neither widget of the divider bar

DzDividerBar::moved ( int  distance  )  [signal]

Emitted when the user has dragged the toggle bar.

Parameters:
distance The distance that the toggle bar has been dragged. If the bar is oriented vertically, this distance will be on the x-axis. If the bar is oriented horizontally, this distance will be on the y-axis.

Parameters:

void DzDividerBar::setOrientation ( Qt::Orientation  o  ) 

Sets the orientation for the divider bar

Parameters:
o The orientation of the divider bar, either Qt::Horizontal, or Qt:Vertical.
void DzDividerBar::setSiblingState ( WidgetType  siblings  ) 

Sets the state of this object to indicate where siblings are in relation to the divider. This is only used to indicate the drawing state of this object (e.g. a divider bar that separates two visual elements may be drawn differently than a divider bar that only has one). You need to set and handle the behavior of this state in your own code.

Parameters:
siblings Sets where siblings are in relation to the divider bar (e.g. If the divider separates two visual elements, then siblings should be DzDividerBar::WTBoth)
void DzDividerBar::setToggleDirection ( WidgetType  toggleDir  ) 

Sets which direction to toggle the divider bar. This is only used to indicate the drawing state of this object (e.g. to display an arrow indicating the where the divider bar will be minimized when clicked). You need to set and handle the behavior of this state in your own code.

Parameters:
toggleDir The direction the divider bar is toggled/minimized when clicked. If toggleDir equals DzDividerBar::WTNone then toggling is disabled.
void DzDividerBar::setToggledState ( bool  onOff  ) 

Sets whether the state of this divider is toggled or not. This is only used to indicate the drawing state of this object. You need to set and handle the behavior of this state in your own code.

Parameters:
onOff Sets the toggled state on this bar.
